attributes.comment:
As the parent of an internationally adopted child, I am deeply concerned about
the proposed rate increases. The costs of adoption are varied and extensive.
Most adoptive parents are not wealthy and bear the entire cost of the process
themselves. For a family seeking to adopt a sibling pair or group, these fees
can contribute to making it prohibitive.

The costs of parenting are borne over time and can be managed. The costs of
meeting fee schedules (and there are many different schedules when adopting) is
complicated because it is out of the family's control. To make the cost of the
adoption process the deciding factor in determining whether a sibling set gets a
family or spends their entire lives in an orphanage is callous.

Please consider the impact of these proposed increases on the lives of real
people rather than solely on the budget.

Thank you,
Rebecca
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Rebecca Sheeham
